author: National Bureau
text:
Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked the government to immediately provide relief to farmers who have suffered crop losses due to the recent rains and hailstorm in north and central States.

Soon after the proceedings started in the Lok Sabha, Mr. Gandhi said the government should respond quickly to the plight of farmers.

“Farmers are in distress following the recent hailstorm and heavy rains. Their crops have been damaged. The government should take immediate action to help them,” he said.

Agriculture Minister Radha Mohan Singh should make a statement in the House, he said.

Serious issue: Venkaiah

Parliamentary Affairs Minister M. Venkaiah Naidu said that he had spoken to the Agriculture Minister on the “serious” issue, and he was in touch with the State governments.

When the Lok Sabha took up zero hour, Speaker Sumitra Mahajan rejected notices for adjournment given by Mr. Gandhi and some other members on the issue.
title: Rahul wants relief to farmers
